page.title: 19Morganite Crucible, Norton
page.content: The impressive industrial chimney of this secluded and rather oddly placed factory is visible for miles around this rough grassland area in The Midlands. Morganite is on a back road near Littleworth. Compared with other factories built in the 1930's, the mere 450 employees is small. During the war years, crucible factories were of vital importance to the war effort. Since then, the demand for crucibles has declined. Originally, the site on which Morganite Crucible now manufactures crucibles for all Europe, housed a jam factory. Selbeys jam factory encouraged local people to grow damsons for their jam. Today, there is a reminder of the old jam factory because damsons still grow profusely.
